author: I want depay to improve, i wouldn't be happy to see him leave
title: Comment on Anthony Martial’s ball-control wows the world wide web (video) by I want depay to improve, i wouldn't be happy to see him leave
text:
Tweet Manchester United won resoundingly 3-0 at Everton today, causing Twitter to explode with Red Devils related search terms. Among the top ten trending terms in the United States this morning: “MUFC,”“Martial,”“Manchester United” and “Rooney.” Even though Anthony Martial didn’t score today, he was still breaking the internet due to his amazing ball control skills and footwork. The reigning Premier League Player of the Month dazzled football fans world wide who took to social media to post videos of his work. 
Watch him get past two defenders at the same time with sublime maneuvering in the Vine below: Anthony Martial has drawn a lot of comparisons to Arsenal legend Thierry Henry, and in sequences like these it’s easy to understand why. At the link below you can see more Martial individual highlights from the match, including a transcendent moment in which he broke down Everton Defender Seamus Coleman, one of the better back line players in the league and a long time supposed Manchester United target. [Video] Anthony Martial absolutely destroyed Coleman – FULL Individual Highlights here ?? http://t.co/6hDgBRXqZr pic.twitter.com/P3OgRfwfuK 
— Man Utd News ?? (@SirAlexStand) October 17, 2015 
Anthony Martial’s career at Old Trafford has gotten off to a dream start, and we have evert reason to believe there’s going to be many more highlight reel moments like this to come. Paul M. Banks owns, operates and sometimes writes The Sports Bank.net , which is partnered with FOX Sports Engage Network. The website is also featured on News Now. Banks, a former writer for the Washington Times, currently contributes to the Chicago Tribune RedEye. He also appears regularly on numerous talk shows all across the country. Catch him Tuesdays on KOZN 1620 The Zone. Follow him on Twitter and Instagram
